result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody M Lynk

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Defendant Cody M Lynk appeared by phone.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by phone for Cody M Lynk.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty proceeding with prelim hearing.  State asking for stipulation for identification as def is not appearing by video.  Atty stipulates.  State calls Amy Odonahue, sworn in, questioned by State.  Atty questions witness.  No redirect.  State makes argument.  Court finds PC that a crime has been committed in Ashland County and case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information, same two counts in the amended complaint.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Cody M Lynk appeared by video.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Cody M Lynk.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint filed has received and reviewed, waives reading and asking for prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:03 AM Defendant Cody M Lynk appeared by video.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Cody M Lynk.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint has not been filed.  Atty has not heard anything since last court hearing. 
 State no update.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ K.G.B or E.C.B. 
No unsupervised contact with any juveniles under the age of 18.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
